definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor

sentences.english: Mixing charm with her trademark sarcasm, she is always full of surprises.
sentences.chinese: 她的諷刺煥發着獨特的魅力，時時刻刻充滿了驚喜。

sentences.english: Liven up a girlie night in with this fabulous Frog Prince Lighted Wine Stopper.
sentences.chinese: 奇異的青蛙王子低度葡萄酒瓶塞讓美女之夜煥發生機。

sentences.english: During the past couple weeks, gold has had the Midas Touch.
sentences.chinese: 在過去幾周裏，黃金煥發着其點石成金的魅力。

sentences.english: All this fresh air reinvigorated me.
sentences.chinese: 清新的空氣使我再次精神煥發。

sentences.english: Jngfang unceasingly send out new life energy in practice.
sentences.chinese: 經方在實踐中不斷煥發出新的生命力。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the old woman was also radiant with joy, returned to her home.
sentences.chinese: 同時，這位老婆婆也容光煥發地回到了家裏。

sentences.english: There is a glow of health in his face.
The policy of reform and opening-up brought Shenzhen, a small town in the past, back to life.
sentences.chinese: 改革開放政策使深圳這個過去的小鎮煥發了生氣。

sentences.english: My lip gloss has the essential oil orange in it which unquestionably lifts my spirits in an instant.
sentences.chinese: 我用的脣彩就內含橘子精油，可以讓我瞬間神采煥發。

sentences.english: There is nothing as refreshing as having a good rest.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比好好休息更讓人精神煥發的了。

sentences.english: It takes the edge off my hangover, kicks up the dust of last night’s drunk and gives it life.
sentences.chinese: 宿醉勾了起來，昨晚已經塵埃落定的醉意又煥發生機。

sentences.english: The flourish of chattel hypothecation benefits from Anglo-American law.
sentences.chinese: 動產抵押制度重新煥發生命力得益於英美法系。

sentences.english: Only the cycle of changes could display spectacular scene.
sentences.chinese: 只有週而復始的變動纔會煥發出萬千的氣象。

sentences.english: The last bits of color disappear as the burner starts to glow red.
sentences.chinese: 最後位元彩色消失，由於燃燒器開始煥發出紅色。
照她一個密友的話說，簡直是“容光煥發”。

definition: opportunity to live/to reprieve from death/life force/vitality
vivid/lively/(of food ingredients) live or fresh
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
